title: Highest Increase in Total Greenhouse Gas Emissions
description: Equatorial Guinea experienced a 3674.11% increase in total greenhouse gas emissions excluding LULUCF from 1990 to 2023, the highest in the world.

title: Highest Increase in Methane Emissions
description: The country's methane emissions, excluding LULUCF, increased by 2942.83% from 1990 to 2023, marking the highest rise globally.

title: Highest Percentage of Nonperforming Loans
description: In 2022, 55.41% of Equatorial Guinea's bank loans were nonperforming, the highest percentage worldwide.

title: Lowest Bank Capital to Assets Ratio
description: Equatorial Guinea had a bank capital to assets ratio of 1.15% in 2022, the lowest in the world.

title: Lowest Growth in Claims on Private Sector
description: The annual growth of claims on the private sector as a percentage of broad money was -25.95% in 2023, the lowest globally.

title: Lowest Primary Completion Rate for Males
description: In 2015, only 37.44% of males in the relevant age group completed primary education, the lowest rate worldwide.

title: Highest Percentage of Male Children Out of School
description: 62.33% of male children of primary school age were out of school in 2015, the highest percentage globally.

title: Lowest Percentage of Trained Male Teachers in Lower Secondary Education
description: Only 11.21% of male teachers in lower secondary education were trained in 2015, the lowest percentage worldwide.

title: Lowest Voice and Accountability Percentile Rank
description: In 2022, Equatorial Guinea had a Voice and Accountability percentile rank of 0.48, the lowest globally.
